required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CSL112 in Healthy Adults and in Adults With Moderate Renal Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Pharmacokinetic, Safety and Tolerability Study of CSL112 in Adult Subjects With Moderate Renal Impairment and in Healthy Adult Subjects With Normal Renal Function

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1 multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, ascending dose study to investigate the pharmacokinetics (PK), safety, and tolerability of CSL112 in adult subjects with moderate renal impairment and in healthy adult subjects with normal renal function.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma apolipoprotein A-I (apoA-I) and phosphatidylcholine (PC) area under the curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
primary_outcome.description: Baseline corrected plasma apoA-I and PC AUC0-infinity

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma apoA-I and PC AUC0-last and AUC 0-t
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
primary_outcome.description: AUC from time point zero to the last quantifiable time point before the analyte first returns to baseline (AUC0-last) and/or a partial AUC from baseline to time point t (AUC0-t) with and without baseline correction

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma apoA-I and PC Volume of distribution during terminal phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 10 time points (during up to 7 days) after infusion
Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
primary_outcome.description: Amount excreted (Ae) of apoA-I over a collection interval 0-t.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
primary_outcome.description: Percent fraction excreted (%fe) of apoA-I in urine over time interval 0-t, calculated as Ae0-t/Dose x 100.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
primary_outcome.description: Renal clearance of apoA-I, calculated as Ae0-48/AUC0-48

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of sucrose excreted over a collection interval 0-t.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Percent fraction excreted sucrose in urine over time interval 0-t, calculated as Ae0-t/Dose x 100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and up to 48 hours after infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Renal clearance of sucrose, calculated as Ae0-48/AUC0-48

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse drug reaction (ADR) or suspected ADR frequency (%)
secondary_outcome.description: The overall percentage of participants with adverse reactions or suspected adverse reactions: That begin during or within 1 hour of an infusion; or That may be causally related to the administration of the investigational product; or For which the Investigator's causality assessment is missing or indeterminate; or For which the incidence in an active treatment arm exceeds the exposure-adjusted incidence rate in the placebo arm by 30% or more, provided the difference in incidence rates is 1% or more.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant changes in routine safety assessments
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with clinically significant changes in any of the following assessments: clinical laboratory tests, physical examinations, body weight, electrocardiograms, vital signs, immunogenicity testing, serology, nucleic acid testing or proteinuria findings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically important change in drug-induced liver injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (before infusion) up to Day 16.
secondary_outcome.description: A clinically important change in drug-induced liver injury is defined as a change (from baseline) in alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal (ULN) or a change in total bilirubin greater than 2 times ULN, that is confirmed upon repeat measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically important change in renal status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (before infusion) up to Day 16.
secondary_outcome.description: A clinically important change in renal status is defined as a serum creatinine (Cr) increase to ≥ 1.5 x the baseline value that is confirmed upon repeat measurement, or the need for renal replacement therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion
secondary_outcome.description: AUC from time point zero to the last quantifiable time point before the analyte first returns to baseline (AUC0-last) and/or a partial AUC from baseline to time point y (AUC0-t) with and without baseline correction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma sucrose Volume of distribution during terminal phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion
Before and at up to 7 time points (during up to 2 days) after infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse drug reaction (ADR) or suspected ADR frequency
secondary_outcome.description: The overall number of participants with adverse reactions or suspected adverse reactions: That begin during or within 1 hour of an infusion; or That may be causally related to the administration of the investigational product; or For which the Investigator's causality assessment is missing or indeterminate; or For which the incidence in an active treatment arm exceeds the exposure-adjusted incidence rate in the placebo arm by 30% or more, provided the difference in incidence rates is 1% or more.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the start of infusion up to approximately 127 days

arm_group.description: A low dose of either CSL112 or placebo is to be administered as a single intravenous (IV) infusion. The placebo will be administered at the same frequency, volume and duration as the CSL112 infusion.

A high dose of either CSL112 or placebo is to be administered as a single intravenous (IV) infusion. The placebo will be administered at the same frequency, volume and duration as the CSL112 infusion.

intervention.description: CSL112 is a novel formulation of apolipoprotein A-I (apoA-I) purified from human plasma and reconstituted to form high-density lipoprotein (HDL) particles.
0.9% weight/volume sodium chloride solution (ie, normal saline)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men or women aged 18 to 85 years (inclusive) of age, with body weight 50 kg or more.
- Subjects with renal impairment (RI) must have stable chronic moderate RI (estimated glomerular filtration rate [eGFR] ≥ 30 and < 60 mL/min/1.73 m2)
- Healthy subjects must have normal renal function (eGFR ≥ 90 mL/min/1.73 m2)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of a clinically significant medical condition, disorder or disease
- Evidence of hepatobiliary disease
- Any clinically relevant abnormal laboratory test result
- Known history of allergies, hypersensitivity or deficiencies to CSL112 or any of its components
- Other severe comorbid condition, concurrent medication, or other issue that renders the subject unsuitable for participation in the study, including: history of cancer, low platelet count, bleeding disorder or coagulopathy, significantly altered electrocardiogram waveform, unstable glycemia control in subjects with diabetes, acute renal failure, recent donation or loss of blood
- Evidence or history of alcohol or substance abuse
